entry.title: Here’s what Dr. Fauci is concerned about as states reopen

media:group.media:title: Here’s what Dr. Fauci is concerned about as states reopen
media:group.media:description: CNN's Anderson Cooper and Dr. Sanjay Gupta speak to Dr. Anthony Fauci about his concerns over states starting to reopen amid the coronavirus pandemic. #CNN #News

entry.title: Hear Nobel Prize winner's bold plan to reopen economy

media:group.media:title: Hear Nobel Prize winner's bold plan to reopen economy
media:group.media:description: Nobel Prize winner Paul Romer discusses his plan to regularly test every American for the coronavirus in order to give people confidence and reopen the economy.

entry.title: WH economic adviser: Numbers haven't been this bad since Great Depression

media:group.media:title: WH economic adviser: Numbers haven't been this bad since Great Depression
media:group.media:description: CNN's Jim Acosta reports on President Trump's response to the economic turmoil Americans are facing, as initial unemployment claims reach 30.3 million over the last six weeks. #CNN #News

entry.title: Deaths soar in country that didn't lock down. Officials identify big reason why

media:group.media:title: Deaths soar in country that didn't lock down. Officials identify big reason why
media:group.media:description: Unlike its European neighbors, Swedish officials did not institute lock down measures to combat the Covid-19 epidemic. CNN's Phil Black takes a look at how that has affected the country's outbreak.

entry.title: Ex-Amazon employee says he was told to stay quiet on coronavirus fears

media:group.media:title: Ex-Amazon employee says he was told to stay quiet on coronavirus fears
media:group.media:description: A fired Amazon warehouse employee says he was urged by supervisors to stay quiet about his concerns over coronavirus in the workplace to avoid panic. CNN's Suzanne Malveaux has more.

entry.title: Small business owner explains why he's defying stay-at-home order

media:group.media:title: Small business owner explains why he's defying stay-at-home order
media:group.media:description: A barber who owns three barber shops in California explained why and how he was opening his shops despite the stay-at-home orders in California remaining in place.

entry.title: He's burying more bodies, but his government denies it's Covid-19

media:group.media:title: He's burying more bodies, but his government denies it's Covid-19
media:group.media:description: Residents of the Nigerian state, Kano, are watching as deaths increase without an official cause. The government has pledged to increase testing for Covid-19, but local officials fear valuable time has been lost in the containment battle. CNN's David McKenzie reports.

entry.title: Images emerge from inside Russian hospital

media:group.media:title: Images emerge from inside Russian hospital
media:group.media:description:
Startling images from a hospital in the south of Russia show how Covid-19 is overstretching its health service. CNN's Matthew Chance reports.
#CNN #News

entry.title: How did the LA Lakers get a coronavirus loan?

media:group.media:title: How did the LA Lakers get a coronavirus loan?
media:group.media:description:
The federal government passed the Paycheck Protection Program to provide emergency financial relief to small businesses during the coronavirus shutdown. Then why exactly did the Lakers and publicly traded companies like Shake Shack, Ruth’s Chris Steakhouse and Potbelly receive millions in funds that they had to return? Chris Cillizza explains.
SOURCES AND FURTHER READING: How, exactly, did the LA Lakers get a 'small business' loan? https://www.cnn.com/2020/04/28/politics/lakers-ppp-small-business/index.html
Glitches hamper second round of small business loan funding https://www.cnn.com/2020/04/27/politics/state-of-play-paycheck-protection-program-small-business-administration/index.html
NBA Team Values 2020: Lakers And Warriors Join Knicks In Rarefied $4 Billion Club https://www.forbes.com/sites/kurtbadenhausen/2020/02/11/nba-team-values-2020-lakers-and-warriors-join-knicks-in-rarefied-4-billion-club/#627264332032
New York Knicks: Is James Dolan the Worst Owner in the NBA? https://bleacherreport.com/articles/777305-new-york-knicks-is-james-dolan-the-worst-owner-in-the-nba
Lakers return $4.6 million coronavirus relief loan https://www.cnn.com/2020/04/27/business/los-angeles-lakers-return-ppp-loan-trnd/index.html
Paycheck Protection Program https://www.sba.gov/funding-programs/loans/coronavirus-relief-options/paycheck-protection-program
Ruth's Chris will return its PPP loans after Treasury says public companies should repay https://www.cnn.com/2020/04/23/business/treasury-public-companies-ppp-loans-repay/index.html
Small business loan funds are tapped out: Here's what owners need to know now https://www.cnn.com/2020/04/16/success/small-businesses-ppp-loans-tapped-out/index.html
Potbelly, Shake Shack, Axios: Here Are All The Companies Returning PPP Money After Public Backlash https://www.forbes.com/sites/sarahhansen/2020/04/29/potbelly-shake-shack-axios-here-are-all-the-companies-returning-ppp-money-after-public-backlash/#5c532bb67ea0
About me: I was named "best dressed" in 7th grade. That, along with being CNN's editor at large and author of the daily "Point" newsletter are my proudest achievements. Look for me here every Tuesday and Thursday to find out what’s really going down in politics.

entry.title: Alisyn Camerota presses Pelosi on allegation against Biden

media:group.media:title: Alisyn Camerota presses Pelosi on allegation against Biden
media:group.media:description:
In an interview with CNN's Alisyn Camerota, House Speaker Nancy Pelosi reiterated she's "satisfied" with how Joe Biden has responded to a sexual assault allegation from a former Senate staffer.
Tara Reade accuses Biden of sexually assaulting her in 1993 when she was an aide in his Senate office. Biden has faced increasing pressure to personally address the claim, which has been denied by his campaign.
#CNN #News

entry.title: 30 million Americans have filed for unemployment since mid-March

media:group.media:title: 30 million Americans have filed for unemployment since mid-March
media:group.media:description:
First-time claims for unemployment benefits totaled 3.8 million in the week ending April 25, after factoring in seasonal adjustments, according to the US Department of Labor. The adjustments accounted for around 300,000 claims.
The latest figures bring the total number of first-time claims to 30.3 million over the past six weeks — representing roughly 18.6% of the US labor force. CNN's Christine Romans and Julia Chatterley explain.
#CNN #News

entry.title: Don Lemon: Trump wants to move on, but this is not over

media:group.media:title: Don Lemon: Trump wants to move on, but this is not over
media:group.media:description:
CNN's Don Lemon calls out President Donald Trump for stopping his daily news briefings and contradicting the advice of experts on his coronavirus task force.
#CNN #News

entry.title: Alvin Ailey's Robert Battle: This is why I dance

media:group.media:title: Alvin Ailey's Robert Battle: This is why I dance
media:group.media:description:
Robert Battle has been charged with continuing Alvin Ailey's formidable legacy, bringing mesmerizing, educational dance to audiences around the world. He shares with CNN why he got into dancing and is driven to carry on Ailey's legacy.
#AlvinAiley #CNN #News

entry.title: Susan Rice: Kushner's comment would be laughable if it weren't deadly serious

media:group.media:title: Susan Rice: Kushner's comment would be laughable if it weren't deadly serious
media:group.media:description: Ambassador Susan Rice, former National Security Adviser to President Obama, responds to President Trump's adviser and son-in-law Jared Kushner's recent statements regarding the Trump administration's response to the coronavirus crisis. #CNN #News
